subject: Re: [junit] mock object for classes
msgSnippet: EasyMock has an extension library for mocking concrete classes. And JMock has a ClassImposteriser extension. See: http://www.jmock.org/mocking-classes.html
messageBody:
EasyMock has an extension library for mocking concrete classes. And JMock
has a ClassImposteriser extension. See:
http://www.jmock.org/mocking-classes.html

However, you might also want to read:
http://www.mockobjects.com/2007/04/test-smell-mocking-concrete-classes.html

David
---
David Peterson
http://blog.davidpeterson.co.uk
http://www.concordion.org
